During a chest pass in basketball, the distance between the wrist and elbow typically decreases as the ball is passed from one player to another, as the passer adjusts their arm position to accurately deliver the pass.
The distance between the shoulders and elbows during a chest pass in basketball can vary based on the player's technique and the specific pass being executed. It is not always consistent.
In shot put, the palm of the hand should face backward at the moment of release to ensure the correct trajectory and distance.
In the shot put release, the back of the hand is typically facing backward to ensure the shot is propelled forward.
During the cushioning process of the lower limbs, the distance between the knee and hip joint typically remains essentially unchanged.
During the stance phase when the lower limbs are buffering, the distance between the knee and ankle decreases as the foot is pushed off the ground and the body weight is transferred to the other leg.
During the cushioning process of the lower limbs, the distance between the ankle and the hip joint typically decreases as the body absorbs impact and cushions the movement.
At the moment of takeoff, a diver typically uses the entire sole of their foot to contact the diving board for a more stable and powerful launch.
When standing on tiptoes, the distance from the heel to the ground is smaller than the distance from the toes to the ground, as the toes extend further out.

When standing on tiptoes, the heel is lifted off the ground, so the distance from the heel to the ground is effectively zero. The distance from the center of the sole to the ground remains constant. Therefore, the distance from the heel to the ground is smaller than the distance from the center of the sole to the ground.
When standing on tiptoes, the distance from the center of the foot sole to the ground is greater than the distance from the toes to the ground, as the body shifts its weight to the front of the foot.
When you extend your lower limbs, you straighten your knee, which increases the distance between your knee and ankle.
When extending the lower limbs, the distance between the knees and buttocks increases as the legs straighten out.
At the moment of jump, the tip of the foot is usually lower than the heel due to the mechanics of the jump and the position of the body during the takeoff.
When jumping off on one foot, the toe of the jumping foot is usually higher than the heel due to the body's center of gravity shifting forward during the jump.
During the whipping motion of the lower limb, the trend in distance change between the ankle and knee is to decrease, as the limb extends and the knee moves away from the ankle.
During the lower limb whipping motion, the distance between the knee and the hip increases as the limb is extended.
When a person stands and rotates their upper body to the left, their left shoulder moves forward relative to the right shoulder.
When a person stands and rotates their upper body to the right, their right shoulder moves forward relative to their left shoulder due to the rotation.
When a person stands and rotates their upper body to the left, their right shoulder is further back because the body rotates in a circular motion, causing the opposite shoulder to move backward.
When a person stands and rotates their upper body to the right, their right shoulder moves forward and their left shoulder moves back, making the left shoulder further back.
In the anatomical position, the left shoulder is typically more forward when a person is seated and turns to the right, due to the positioning of the arms and shoulders.
In the anatomical position, the right shoulder is typically more forward when a person is seated and turns to the left, due to the positioning of the arms and shoulders.
When a person is seated and turns to the right, their left shoulder is usually further back.

When a person is seated and turns to the left, their right shoulder is typically further back because the body naturally rotates around the spine, placing the right shoulder behind the left when turning left.
